citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thermogemmatispora (Ther′mo.gem.ma′ti.spo′ra. Gr. adj. thermos hot; L. adj. gemmatus provided with buds; Gr. n. spora a seed and, in biology, a spore; N.L. fem. n. Thermogemmatispora thermophilic budding-spored organism).
Thermophilic aerobic heterotrophs with glutamic acid, serine, glycine, histidine, alanine and ornithine as peptidoglycan amino acids and rhamnose as a cell-wall sugar.
iso-C17 : 0, iso-C19 : 0 and C20 : 0 are the major fatty acids and MK-9(H2) is the major menaquinone.
The polar lipids consist of phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylglycerol and a glycolipid.
The type species is Thermogemmatispora onikobensis.
